question: “Mission 25 by 2022”, sometimes seen in news, is associated to which of the following?
explanation: Government has recently announced the setting up of National Nutrition Mission which would benefit nearly 10 crore people in the country. It aims to cover all the States and districts in the country i.e. 315 districts in 2017-18, 235 districts in 2018-19 and remaining districts in 2019-20. It aims to reduce the level of stunting, under-nutrition, anemia and low birth weight babies. It would strive to achieve reduction in Stunting from 38.4% (NFHS-4) to 25% by 2022 (Mission 25 by 2022). The mission will be funded by Government Budgetary Support (50%) and 50% by IBRD or other MDB. The support ratio would be 60:40 between Centre and States/UTs, 90:10 for NER and Himalayan States, and 100% for UTs without legislature.
